channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: The Stunning Ascendance Of America's Crazy Drunk Uncle: Florida
item.description: Here are five more reasons why Florida is the nation's current cultural capital.

item.title: The All-Electric Car You Never Plug In
item.description: Picture an all-electric vehicle cruising down the highway, emitting little noise and no noxious fumes. It’s such an improvement that you have to wonder why only a handful of all-electric vehicles are now available on the mass market.

item.title: The King Of Oontz Oontz Oontz
item.description: Four years ago, he was just some Swedish kid named Tim who liked messing around on his laptop at home. One iTunes-dominating dance hit later, he's Avicii, world's hottest DJ, making $250,000 a night to keep the Ecstasy-dosed masses moving.

item.title: What's The Deadliest Power Source?
item.description: Coal, nuclear, oil, wind, gas, solar—which one is going to kill you?

item.title: Hacking The World's Cheapest Computer
item.description: It may not be the prettiest, but the world's smallest, cheapest personal computer is inspiring a wave of delightful DIY innovation among tech hobbyists across the planet.

item.title: What 12 Now-Famous Tech Executives Looked Like When They Were Young
item.description: What did today's most famous people in tech look like when they were young? We dug up some old photos.

item.title: Six Words That Mean Something Very Different To Porn Stars
item.description: When you say ‘ATM’ to a porn star, she doesn’t think of a cash dispenser. Aurora Snow explains the industry’s down-low lingo. And what’s this about piña colada mix?

item.title: Men Who Do More Housework Have Less Sex
item.description: Conventional wisdom suggests that women are drawn to men who help out around the house. Yet new research indicates that some divisions of labor may be sexier than others.

item.title: 4-Billion-Pixel Panorama Of Mars
item.description: Pan and zoom among 400 images from Curiosity's cameras.

item.title: The Tech World's Mutually Assured Destruction
item.description: Google has joined Twitter in declaring that it will only use (parts of) its patent portfolio in a defensive way. What the patent wars can learn from the Cold War.

item.title: Meet Harry Beck, The Genius Behind London's Iconic Subway Map
item.description: A look back at the man who changed the way people move.

item.title: What Do Soulja Boy And Neil Patrick Harris Have In Common?
item.description: Though Google Glass makes even models look vaguely dorky, a host of celebs are lining up to try them out.

item.title: 11 Ways Rappers Are Just Like Right-Wing Radio Hosts
item.description: Rick Ross’s half-assed apology for his date-rape song is just like ones offered by conservative radio hosts. And that’s not the only thing they have in common.

item.title: 5 Things You Might Not Know About Tim Burton's 'Beetlejuice'
item.description: This week, Tim Burton's wild supernatural comedy "Beetlejuice" turns a whopping 25 years old. To commemorate the occasion, we've compiled a list of five things that you might not know about the endlessly quotable, wonderfully inventive movie.

item.title: This Large Bird Was Given A Metal Pegleg, Is Now Some Kind Of Cyborg
item.description: What's even cooler is that the bird was even given so much attention at all.

item.title: A Whale's Eye View
item.description: A deep dive into how the most intelligent creatures in the ocean perceive their world.

item.title: Pork Your Lover In Style With Bacon Condoms
item.description: So apparently this bacon trend hasn’t gone far enough. Now you can do the dirty with these Bacon Condoms.

item.title: Bitcoin May Be The Global Economy's Last Safe Haven
item.description: One of the oddest bits of news to emerge from the economic collapse of Cyprus is a corresponding rise in the value of Bitcoin, the Internet’s favorite, media-friendly, anarchist crypto-currency.

item.title: Congress Plans To Make Computer Crime Law Much, Much Worse
item.description: Work is currently afoot for "Aarons Law" legislation, which simplifies and brings a measure of sense to the law, but now the House Judiciary Committee has begun circulating an update to the CFAA that can only be described as a "screw you" to internet users and the very concept of justice as a whole.

item.title: Craigslist Bounty Hunters Are Watching You Pirate Pay-Per-View Fights
item.description: Boxing fans: Don't you just hate it when your local bar shows the big fight? Don't you wish you could help shut them down? If so, there's a job opening for you.

item.title: 12 Lonely Negative Words
item.description: Are you disgusted, disgruntled and disheveled? Well, unfortunately you’re never going to be gusted, gruntled or sheveled.

item.title: The Hail Mary Products Of Desperate Companies
item.description: It's the longshot, the one thing that could save the company. Sometimes it resonates so well with the masses that the company is saved from oblivion. Sometimes, even the best products can't stop the inevitable.
